entry.title: cros_next: stylize focus ring for capture buttons
entry.content:
Capture buttons do not have stylized focus ring because the base

views::Button class will install a default focus ring such that the

capture mode highlightable view will not install the stylized focus

ring. Therefore, we should manually install the stylized focus ring

for capture buttons.

entry.title: Handle early errors when loading unpacked extensions.
entry.content:
This fixes an issue where an erroneous manifest loading error would be

shown in a variety of unrelated cases, such as when policy prevents

the installation of unpacked extensions.



This was caused by an assumption made in ExtensionsLoadErrorElement that

the load error passed in would always be a LoadError. Unfortunately,

this isn't the case which was missed because of the loose error typing

in TypeScript. There are many instances where our APIs reject calls

with an Error object containing a message.



To resolve this, I have correctly typed the possible errors that this

component needs to handle and added some basic logic for displaying the

message property of an error if one is passed in.



Bug: 1448680

Change-Id: I37fccf04b9d208e1d9e8cad470d09a3071ae8864

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4615076

entry.title: Segmentation: Auto gen the histogram variant names
entry.content:
The histogram variant strings are sometimes mismatched with the enum

strings. Also this function needs another code update when adding new

segment IDs. Auto generate the strings to avoid the code changes.



Update the histograms associated with the changed variant names.

the dashboard to overflow for segmentation filters in the UMA names

list, and also on demand segment selection is no longer used with multi

output API.

entry.title: Updater: Periodically delete old versions of the updater.
entry.content:
In the case that old instances are buggy and can no longer manage their

own self-uninstalls, this allows the active instance to find and

uninstall (or outright delete) older instances.



In the future, the maximum version number to clean up could be made

dynamic (based on an offset from kUpdaterVersion), but that doesn't

seem to be necessary at this time.



Fixed: 1458599

entry.title: Add ash switches for passing testing keeplist data.
entry.content:
This cl implements the following:

1. Add ash commandline switches for passing testing

ash extension keeplist data, which allows injecting the testing

extension and chrome app in ash extension keeplist and make the

testing more flexible. This is intended to be used by tests only.



2. Use testing extension and chrome app to replace the

fake GCSE and gnubbyd app (which have the same extension ids

of GCSE and gnubbydapp) in ExtensionAppsAppServiceBlocklistTest.

Once this change propagate to the stable ash channel, we

will completely remove the fake GCSE and fake gnubbyd app from

test data.



3. Remove the backward compatibility tests for old ash prior to

crosapi::mojom::StandaloneBrowserAppServiceBlockList(M111).





Bug: 1409199

entry.title: [iOS] Fix crash on [ArchivableCredentialStore saveDataWithCompletion:]
entry.content:
The crash was caused by

[[NSFileManager defaultManager] createDirectoryAtURL:self.fileURL...]

being called with a `nil` URL. The fact that the completion block of

`saveDataWithCompletion` was holding a strong reference to `self`

seemed to be the root cause of the issue. Hence, this CL uses a weak

self in the completion block and early returns when `self` is `nil`.



Since the crash couldn't be reproduced, it will be monitored to make

sure this fix does fix the issue.



Fixed: 1449638

Change-Id: If114a2dfd5602afebffc6347ff60079ed631203f

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Update toolbar when NTP becomes active
entry.content:
The toolbar needs to know when the NTP page becomes active.

For the primary toolbar, this is currently done by:

1. NTP becomes active in browser coordinator

2. browser coordinator updates BVC

3. BVC updates toolbar



In the effort of removing BVC dependencies, update the secondary toolbar

directly through NewTabPageControllerDelegate.



Once other dependencies are removed, the updateToolbar call from BVC

might be removed.

entry.title: [autofill] Remove never-recorded bucket for Autofill.CardUploadEnabled
entry.content:
From the very first implementation in https://crrev.com/c/1564535 the

bucket couldn't have been recorded, because the code is unreachable

outside tests after SyncService::GetActiveDataTypes() is used to

report another bucket, which is

CardUploadEnabled::kSyncServiceMissingAutofillWalletDataActiveType.



In this patch, instead of fixing the implementation, the

never-recorded bucket is removed and tests updated to make them

more realistic.

entry.title: [iOS] Implement UIShutdownNoDismiss in add account
entry.content:
This patch implement correctly the case to interrupt

AddAccountSigninCoordinator and AddAccountSigninManager for

SigninCoordinatorInterrupt::UIShutdownNoDismiss.



For UIShutdownNoDismiss case, the UI doesn't need to be dismiss, but

sign-in completion block and the interrupt completion block need to be

called in that order and synchronously before the end of

-[SigninCoordinator interruptWithAction:completion:].



Related to crrev.com/c/4665648.

entry.title: [ios] Fix failed DCHECK in CVC prompt due to invalid dates.
entry.content:
The CVC prompt uses a UIPickerView for the user to input new expiration

dates on a credit card. If this date is invalid (i.e. in the past) the

submit button in the prompt is disabled but due to a slight ui delay

the user is able to submit the form with an invalid date. This patch

guards against this case.



Fixed: 1413049

entry.title: [autofill] Refactor tests to avoid crashes
entry.content:
Using RunLoop::QuitClosure() for EXPECT_CALL/ON_CALL is more robust

because it doesn't crash if a test invokes the mock function later,

once the RunLoop instance has been destroyed. Usually, this would also

lead to test failures, but there is no reason to crash (which prevents

other tests from running).



Along with this refactoring, some other minor changes are bundled:

some test names are updated to reflect what they actually test, and

the unnecessary special-casing (exclusion) for IS_LINUX removed.



Change-Id: I1953c1ff0a7e71b8d5002f2c6f1e0d4b0fb27a2c

Bug: 1459963, 1007974

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4669447

entry.content:
This reverts commit 4f60fae4c509bdcacbe31620e1a2f6809b6899a0.



Reason for revert: Breaks compile for https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-centipede-asan-rel/31/overview

>

> https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/google/fuzztest.git/+log/0e6385f1b488..3c3e32de6189

>

> $ git log 0e6385f1b..3c3e32de6 --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

> 2023-07-06 xinhaoyuan #Centipede Change the mutator interface to work with ExecutionMetadata instead of CMP entries.

> 2023-07-06 xinhaoyuan #Centipede Create ExecutionMetadata to abstract the metadata from executing one input, which currently includes only the CMP entries but planned with more fields.

> 2023-07-06 kcc #Centipede document --distill, and the fact that --distill_shards is deprecated

> 2023-07-05 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-07-05 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-06-30 sergeygs #Centipede Monitoring: Add stats acquisition timestamp to reported fields

> 2023-06-30 kcc Internal change

> 2023-06-29 fuzztest #Centipede Updates the references of the data read, write and reset from `SharedMemoryBlobSequence` to `BlobSequence`.

> 2023-06-29 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-06-28 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-06-26 sergeygs #Centipede Monitoring: Avoid bogus "Flags:" printed when there are no flags to report

> 2023-06-26 fuzztest #Centipede Move `Blob` out of `SharedMemoryBlobSequence`.

> 2023-06-23 xinhaoyuan #Centipede Ignore short/long cmp entries instead of skipping the rest of the entries.

> 2023-06-23 kcc #Centipede skeleton of --distill (standalone distillation), not functional yet.

> 2023-06-23 xinhaoyuan #Centipede Fix shmem leakage by using memfd_create instead of shm_open.

> 2023-06-23 fuzztest #Centipede Remove the weak sancov symbols from the main Centipede binary, now that we have a Blaze transition that can completely eliminate instrumentation.

> 2023-06-22 fuzztest #Centipede Define a Blaze transition and a new target that produces an uninstrumented (best-effort) Centipede main binary.

> 2023-06-22 sergeygs #Centipede Monitoring: Continuously dump fuzzing stats to CSV

> 2023-06-21 sergeygs #Centipede Add `Environment::` function to get CSV perf report path

> 2023-06-21 sergeygs #Centipede Monitoring: Refactor stats reporting to prepare for continuously dumping stats to CSV

> 2023-06-20 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-06-20 fuzztest #Centipede Link weak sancov stubs in the main Centipede binary. This is a prerequisite of building the binary as a data dependency of a runner target.

> 2023-06-20 dmauro Fix WithSeeds() error message string generation

> 2023-06-15 sergeygs #Centipede LOG -> VLOG(1) for a noisy message

> 2023-06-15 sergeygs #Centipede Tweak VV macro to easily copy var values in console by double-clicking

> 2023-06-15 yongheng Ensure that fuzztest can be built with FetchContent.

> 2023-06-15 yongheng Add missing include to make protobuf_domain_impl.h self-contained.

> 2023-06-15 sfreilich Internal change

> 2023-06-14 xinhaoyuan Fix a potential container overflow due to assign() changing the mutant size.

> 2023-06-13 fuzztest Internal change

> 2023-06-13 kcc Internal change

> 2023-06-12 kcc #Centipede implement support for -fsanitize-coverage=inline-8bit-counters

> 2023-06-09 kcc #Centipede reset callstack in runner/PrepareCoverage. Change the Resest function name.

> 2023-06-08 kcc #Centipede: VLOG(1) the time it took to execute or mutate a batch.

> 2023-06-08 kcc #Centipede: when mutating via the target binary, don't collect coverage as it won't be used anyway.

> 2023-06-07 xinhaoyuan Avoid clang coverage in fuzz targets in centipede/testing, otherwise it can interfere with sancov instrumentation and break test expectations.

> 2023-06-06 kcc #Centipede clear the startup coverage before executing the first input.

> 2023-06-05 kcc #Centipede use RollingHash in HashedRingBuffer

> 2023-06-02 kcc #Centipede Move HashedRingBuffer to a separate file, NFC

> 2023-06-02 kcc #Centipede make the oom puzzle use less RAM, to deflake it.

entry.title: Nuke WebUIWebViewBrowserTest.AddContentScriptIncognito
entry.content:
This browser test was disabled for years. It was intended to test

adding scripts to the WebUIs in incognito mode, but it was only

enabled on ChromeOS. However on ChromeOS it is already tested by

AddContentScript test running on OOBE WebUI, which is shown under

SigninProfile (which is the same as incognito).

entry.title: [ios] Reset new per-account UserSelectableType prefs on egtest start
entry.content:
Test-only change.

Prefs are not reset between egtests, so there's custom logic to reset

certain allowlisted ones. Among them are the prefs backing sync's

UserSelectableTypes.

crbug.com/1446965 introduces new per-account prefs when

kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is enabled, so those need to be

reset too.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Break large local network access test file into smaller
entry.content:
ones and await without timeout for positive cases.



This CL breaks test fenced-frame.tentative.https.window.js

into two:

1. New fenced-frame-no-preflight-required.tentative.https.window.js

contains all test cases that do not require local network access

preflights.

2. fenced-frame.tentative.https.window.js contains all other test

cases that require preflight.



Also changed to await the value from server without timeout if the

expected test result is success.



The goal is to avoid timeout.



Why tests are slow?

For fenced frames, we obtain messages by writing value to/reading

value from a server. This is significantly slower than similar tests

using iframes, because iframes can simply use `window.postMessage()`.



Does `// META: timeout=long` help?

In the reland CL (crrev.com/c/4595521) which introduces the tests, I

have already specified long timeout.



It solved the flakiness for the other test

fenced-frame-subresource-fetch.tentative.https.window.js, but not this

test.



History of test results, before it was marked in TestExpectations, it

was very flaky. Failures are all due to timeouts.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Ffenced-frame-mparch%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Flocal-network-access%2Ffenced-frame.tentative.https.window.html?q=V%3Abuilder%3DLinux%2520Tests%2520%28dbg%29%281%29+V%3Aos%3DUbuntu-22.04+V%3Atest_suite%3Dblink_wpt_tests



Bug: 1454910, 1451954

entry.title: Move kAutofillWalletImportEnabled into components/sync
entry.content:
No expected behavioral changes, although some of the

observer-notification codepaths are hard to prove.



Motivation: the user preference can only be toggled from Sync settings

and isn't actually any different to other toggles in the same UI

(modulo https://crbug.com/1435431). Most code can be simplified by

moving this pref closer to analogous prefs for other features, under

SyncPrefs.



In this patch, as a first step, the APIs in autofill_prefs.h, namely

`IsPaymentsIntegrationEnabled` and `SetPaymentsIntegrationEnabled` are

replaced with analogous APIs in SyncUserSettings. This is achieved

without actually extending the UserSelectableType enum to make the

patch smaller, but TODOs are added to track follow-up work to unify

things further.



Internally, the pref is handled by SyncPrefs, which now takes ownership

of the pre-existing autofill pref, without data migrations. Data

migrations are planned for the near future due to unrelated reasons, so

the preference name itself will not exist for long (which is desirable

given that it starts with "autofill." and yet the code lives under

sync/).



To support observing changes to the preference, SyncServiceObserver

is extended with a dedicated function. This is rather intrusive and

not desirable in the long term, but it is a convenient way to unblock

the change and minimize the risk for accidental behavioral changes.



Change-Id: I90220ab70fc40cbc61680a05f94aef13ff7667fa

entry.title: Revert "Change the Rust channel reported by rustc from nightly to dev"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e45fbba9d024fb990c02ef7391b9a03a05b42716.



Reason for revert: rustc still claims to be nightly and looks for nightly sanitizer libraries



Original change's description:

> Change the Rust channel reported by rustc from nightly to dev

>

> This prevents crates from opting into using unstable nightly features,

> if they check for the channel in their build scripts, as as

> we'd prefer to be building/shipping them in a more stable form.

>

> This also matches the channel used by Android for the compiler they

> build.

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Support multiple track_event sessions
entry.content:
This CL makes it possible to start multiple simultaneous track_event

tracing sessions in Chrome when it's built with Perfetto SDK.



Legacy EnabledStateObservers won't be exposed to this (some of them

actually crash when OnTraceLogEnabled is called twice), they will only

be notified of the start of the first tracing session and the end of

the last one. This is fine, as long as their behavior doesn't depend

on the tracing session's config. There are two cases when it does:

memory instrumentation, and package name filtering from Java events.

Those will be fixed in subsequent CLs.



CustomEventRecorder has limited support for simultaneous sessions:

it guarantees that every tracing session will get histograms it asked

for, but samples from other histograms can also appear in the trace.



Datasources registered via PerfettoTracedProcess::DataSourceProxy

can only participate in one tracing session at a time. They will

silently fail to start the second instance if requested.

entry.title: PDM: Consider wallet integration disabled in OTR and guest profiles
entry.content:
SyncService doesn't exist in off-the-record or guest, so wallet import

is effectively disabled, regardless of what the preference holds. It

seems more appropriate that

PersonalDataManager::IsAutofillWalletImportEnabled() returns false in

such cases, which is precisely the behavioral change in this patch.



Note however that some of the autofill flows use the regular PDM

instance even from incognito, and autofill works normally. This patch

doesn't change the behavior for these cases, as the regular PDM

instance's behavior doesn't change (it uses a non-null SyncService

before and after this patch).



The change is done in preparation for kAutofillWalletImportEnabled

moving fully into SyncService, which also means that the preference

cannot be evaluated if SyncService doesn't exist.



Many unit-tests need updating because they now required injectinng a

non-null SyncService, simply because they rely on

IsAutofillWalletImportEnabled() returning true.



Change-Id: I192c3e342e9cf792127c309480b5e8e9605cd7a7

entry.title: Reject promise in ConcatenatingUnerlyingSource when no controller
entry.content:
When ConcatenatingUnderlyingSourceReadRequest::CloseSteps is called,

sometimes the controller does not exist as it may have been cleared

when a transferred stream is canceled. This CL rejects the promise if

the controller is cleared by the time CloseSteps is called to reduce

the number of use-after-free crashes.



Bug: 1462444, 1418910

entry.title: Fix HW encoder glitch by forcing a copy in the otherwise 0c path.
entry.content:
The combination of the Windows 0-copy code path,

MediaFoundationVideoEncodeAccelerator using this texture and the page

being in view such that the same texture is concurrently used for

rendering, causes some pretty severe glitches in Google Meet when an

experiment is enabled. This CL fixes that by copying the texture, which

is believed to be preferred over holding the mutex since encoding can

take a significant amount of time and even read-only uses of a texture

requires acquiring the mutex. Concurrent usage would thus block if we

held the mutex for an entire encode call.



TESTED=Manually by verifying that the glitch in Google Meet goes away



Bug: chromium:1462315

Change-Id: I6f91d75e50d097479bb043154cfefa1c1165e7e9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4667150

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Commit-Queue: Henrik Bostr√∂m

entry.title: [Passwords] Add chunking password generation experiment
entry.content:
Modifies password generator to create a max entropy password with dash

symbol every 4th character for sites where:

* we can create password longer than 8 chars

* dash symbol is allowed



Password is generatedd by creating a max entropy password the usual

way for a reduced length (leaving space for dashes) and then inserting

dashes every 4th char.



The logic is protected by a feature flag.



Mock: http://docs/presentation/d/1X2WK0h3p3F9pTYyIZM7B7WnSjDsPjmUs8Qmnn7N-WS0?resourcekey=0-lEqytWiaaau0BR8ZJtQt7A#slide=id.g142b2c2fe2d_1_63



Bug: 1444071

entry.title: Reland "Use fixed flat maps for defining mojom::PrefPath mappings."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4447fa4706df6c7ae30ab3ebfc215e466d5fd2ac



This was reverted for a build break, but the actual build break was

introduced by a CL that landed several hours later and was already auto

reverted: https://crrev.com/c/4660361



Original change's description:

> Use fixed flat maps for defining mojom::PrefPath mappings.

>

> This is more memory efficient and requires no heap allocations. However,

> since a constexpr FixedFlatMap requires constexpr input, various pref

> constants have been migrated to be defined using constexpr.

>

entry.title: Supervised Users will stay signed in when cookies are cleared
entry.content:

from being signed out when the user clears cookies on desktop through

the `chrome://settings/clearBrowserData` UI.
